list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Update transaction handling in accounts views
Adjusted the way transactions adjust the account balance in accounts/views.py. Transactions will now accurately reflect the updated account balances post-transaction.

task.summary: Default task

Update .gitignore file
Added new entries to the .gitignore file to exclude commonly unwanted directories and files. This will prevent them from being tracked by git, simplifying the development process.

Unintended committed files
Two apps were added. Not having the proper .gitignore attributes, thousands of .venv files were also added.

Remove unnecessary files from commit
Cleared unwanted files that were mistakenly added to the repository due to the absence of proper .gitignore attributes. Specifically, these were thousands of .venv files. Also, two unintended apps were included and subsequently removed.

Remove unused static files from the project
A bulk of static files were removed in this commit. These files primarily include aspects of the admin interface design and JavaScript code, as well as the i18n localization data. They were no longer needed or used in the application, hence the removal, which leads to cleaner project structure and lower overall project size.

Optimize 'request.user' object retrieval method
The 'request.user' object is now directly assigned to 'member', instead of separately fetching it from the database. This change benefits the application by reducing database calls, hence optimizing performance. Few static and template files were also modified as part of project structure refinement.

Fix 'Settings' hyperlink in the base template
The code has been revised to correct the hyperlink of the 'Settings' option in the navigation bar, redirecting it from 'accounts:settings' to 'accounts:profile'. The profile link in the dropdown menu has also been fixed to point to the 'accounts:profile' URL. These changes improve navigation and provide accurate guidance for users.

Refactor model declarations with improved structure
The model classes and admin site registrations have been shuffled between accounts and dash applications to follow a more logical structure. This commit moves Account, UserSetting, CreditCard, and Transaction models from the dash app to the accounts app and updates the corresponding imports in the admin. The admin registrations for these models are accordingly updated in both apps. Furthermore, Password and Port fields for the database connection in settings.py were modified.

Update application layout, database settings, and import declarations
Application layout is realigned by moving Account, UserSetting, CreditCard, and Transaction models from the dash app to the accounts app, simultaneously updating corresponding imports in the admin. Additionally, Password and Port fields for the database connection are adjusted in settings.py to improve security and maintain coherent code structure.

Update views, database settings and page layouts
Expanded and refactored several views in accounts/views.py, including the addition of a new login() function. Updated database connection settings in settings.py for improved security. Large-scale changes made to the home.html template in the accounts application, with many new features added. A considerable number of new static files were also included alongside these changes.

Implement user authentication logic and improve routes
Improved login and logout logic in account views, adjusted URLs for better navigation. Created suitable name attributes for input fields and form submission in home.html. Also, fixed paths for carousel images in base_2.html template.

Restructure home page and update user login form handling
This commit includes major change in the structure and content of the home.html template. Specifically, the login form is now only displayed if the user is not authenticated. Additionally, placeholder texts and headings have been replaced with relevant banking-related content to provide a more complete and user-friendly interface. Unnecessary changes in workspace.xml have been cleaned up as well.

Update form error handling and improve transactions
Enhanced error handling in wallet.html form and allocation of account numbers for users. The form now correctly displays error messages and includes a new section for displaying messages. In accounts/views.py, a system for generating unique account numbers has been implemented and new transactions are now properly saved to the bank account. Minor changes have also been made to the admin settings to reflect the model name changes.

Refactor wallet.html and enhance transaction handling
This commit aims to enhance error handling in the form within wallet.html and improve the allocation of account numbers. It successfully depicts error messages and includes a new section for displaying messages. The system for generating unique account numbers in accounts/views.py has been refined and transactions are now correctly saved to the respective bank accounts. Accompanied by minor changes in the admin settings correlating to model name changes.

Simplify transaction form and improve error handling
DEPOSIT's are now working but some of the values are hardcoded and still need to be addressed prior to the task being labeled as completed.
This commit simplifies the deposit transaction form in wallet.html by removing account selection and fixes error handling in the account deposit function. It also ensures that CSRF tokens are included in all forms to prevent cross-site request forgery attacks.

Refactor wallet.html and update transaction handling
Updated code to improve account management in wallet.html, adopting DRY principles and simplifying user interface. Additionally, implemented better error handling for transaction processing, specifically to manage invalid 'amount' and 'transaction_type' inputs.

Clean up wallet.html template and update transaction operations
Simplified wallet.html template by removing unnecessary lines and loose error handling. Enhanced transaction operations in views.py by ensuring properly updated account balance after each transaction.

Refactor transaction handling and cleanup wallet.html template
Streamlined transaction operations in the views.py file to guarantee accurate updating of account balance post each transaction. Enhanced the wallet.html template by getting rid of superfluous lines and implementing robust error handling.

Update transaction types in account model
Transaction type field in Transaction model of account module has been expanded to include two additional types - 'transfer' and 'payment'. This gives more granularity in categorizing account transactions, improving transactional record and analysis.

Improve Bank Account HTML Template
Updated the Bank Account HTML template to enhance transaction record functionality. Bank account types were isolated to individual accordions for better consistency. Additionally, improvements were made in the bank transaction form, especially in transferring funds between accounts.

Add Django logging file, enhance transaction display, and account balance updating
The wallet.html template now has added CSS styles, making the transaction table more readable by presenting varying background colors based on transaction types. Also, the form for creating bank transactions has been improved for simpler transfer handling between accounts. Additionally, the transaction handling in views.py now includes a more accurate post-transaction account balance updating mechanism.
This commit includes a new log file for the Django application under 'course_project_group_3'. It records file changes, HTTP requests, and server responses, providing an essential tool for understanding the runtime behavior, debugging, and problem diagnosis of the application.

Add Django logging file, enhance transaction display, and account balance updating
The wallet.html template now has added CSS styles, making the transaction table more readable by presenting varying background colors based on transaction types. Also, the form for creating bank transactions has been improved for simpler transfer handling between accounts. Additionally, the transaction handling in views.py now includes a more accurate post-transaction account balance updating mechanism.
This commit includes a new log file for the Django application under 'course_project_group_3'. It records file changes, HTTP requests, and server responses, providing an essential tool for understanding the runtime behavior, debugging, and problem diagnosis of the application.

Update wallet.html for better transaction readability & handling
Improved transaction table readability in wallet.html using CSS styles and revised date formatting. Addition of expense transaction type and updated handling of various transaction types has also been implemented. Further, made enhancements in the form used for bank transactions.

Update transaction handling in accounts views
Adjusted the way transactions adjust the account balance in accounts/views.py. Transactions will now accurately reflect the updated account balances post-transaction.

MESSAGE.value:
Unintended committed files
Two apps were added. Not having the proper .gitignore attributes, thousands of .venv files were also added.

Remove unnecessary files from commit
Cleared unwanted files that were mistakenly added to the repository due to the absence of proper .gitignore attributes. Specifically, these were thousands of .venv files. Also, two unintended apps were included and subsequently removed.

Remove unused static files from the project
A bulk of static files were removed in this commit. These files primarily include aspects of the admin interface design and JavaScript code, as well as the i18n localization data. They were no longer needed or used in the application, hence the removal, which leads to cleaner project structure and lower overall project size.

Optimize 'request.user' object retrieval method
The 'request.user' object is now directly assigned to 'member', instead of separately fetching it from the database. This change benefits the application by reducing database calls, hence optimizing performance. Few static and template files were also modified as part of project structure refinement.

Refine 'request.user' retrieval and modify templates
The 'request.user' object retrieval has been improved by directly assigning it to the variable 'member'. This reduces database calls, optimizes application performance, and simplifies code. Some static and template files were also adjusted to refine the project structure.

Fix 'Settings' hyperlink in the base template
The code has been revised to correct the hyperlink of the 'Settings' option in the navigation bar, redirecting it from 'accounts:settings' to 'accounts:profile'. The profile link in the dropdown menu has also been fixed to point to the 'accounts:profile' URL. These changes improve navigation and provide accurate guidance for users.

Refactor model declarations with improved structure
The model classes and admin site registrations have been shuffled between accounts and dash applications to follow a more logical structure. This commit moves Account, UserSetting, CreditCard, and Transaction models from the dash app to the accounts app and updates the corresponding imports in the admin. The admin registrations for these models are accordingly updated in both apps. Furthermore, Password and Port fields for the database connection in settings.py were modified.

Update application layout, database settings, and import declarations
Application layout is realigned by moving Account, UserSetting, CreditCard, and Transaction models from the dash app to the accounts app, simultaneously updating corresponding imports in the admin. Additionally, Password and Port fields for the database connection are adjusted in settings.py to improve security and maintain coherent code structure.

Update views, database settings and page layouts
Expanded and refactored several views in accounts/views.py, including the addition of a new login() function. Updated database connection settings in settings.py for improved security. Large-scale changes made to the home.html template in the accounts application, with many new features added. A considerable number of new static files were also included alongside these changes.

Implement user authentication logic and improve routes
Improved login and logout logic in account views, adjusted URLs for better navigation. Created suitable name attributes for input fields and form submission in home.html. Also, fixed paths for carousel images in base_2.html template.

Update website content and aesthetics
Redesigned the content and imagery on the home page and updated annual percentage rates. Implemented new user registration logic in the account views and improved navigation routes on the website.

Restructure home page and update user login form handling
This commit includes major change in the structure and content of the home.html template. Specifically, the login form is now only displayed if the user is not authenticated. Additionally, placeholder texts and headings have been replaced with relevant banking-related content to provide a more complete and user-friendly interface. Unnecessary changes in workspace.xml have been cleaned up as well.

Update form error handling and improve transactions
Enhanced error handling in wallet.html form and allocation of account numbers for users. The form now correctly displays error messages and includes a new section for displaying messages. In accounts/views.py, a system for generating unique account numbers has been implemented and new transactions are now properly saved to the bank account. Minor changes have also been made to the admin settings to reflect the model name changes.

Refactor wallet.html and enhance transaction handling
This commit aims to enhance error handling in the form within wallet.html and improve the allocation of account numbers. It successfully depicts error messages and includes a new section for displaying messages. The system for generating unique account numbers in accounts/views.py has been refined and transactions are now correctly saved to the respective bank accounts. Accompanied by minor changes in the admin settings correlating to model name changes.

Simplify transaction form and improve error handling
DEPOSIT's are now working but some of the values are hardcoded and still need to be addressed prior to the task being labeled as completed.
This commit simplifies the deposit transaction form in wallet.html by removing account selection and fixes error handling in the account deposit function. It also ensures that CSRF tokens are included in all forms to prevent cross-site request forgery attacks.

Refactor transaction form and improve error handling
Moved the table header outside the for-loop in wallet.html form. Updated create_deposit_transaction function to handle potential issues related to receiving 'amount' and 'transaction_type'.
The update in the accounts/views.py file will now handle the case if the amount is None by setting it to 0 and print out more debugging information for transaction type and amount. Finally, some changes were done in .idea/workspace.xml for managing tasks and committing message.

Refactor wallet.html and update transaction handling
Updated code to improve account management in wallet.html, adopting DRY principles and simplifying user interface. Additionally, implemented better error handling for transaction processing, specifically to manage invalid 'amount' and 'transaction_type' inputs.

Clean up wallet.html template and update transaction operations
Simplified wallet.html template by removing unnecessary lines and loose error handling. Enhanced transaction operations in views.py by ensuring properly updated account balance after each transaction.

Refactor transaction handling and cleanup wallet.html template
Streamlined transaction operations in the views.py file to guarantee accurate updating of account balance post each transaction. Enhanced the wallet.html template by getting rid of superfluous lines and implementing robust error handling.

Update transaction types in account model
Transaction type field in Transaction model of account module has been expanded to include two additional types - 'transfer' and 'payment'. This gives more granularity in categorizing account transactions, improving transactional record and analysis.

Improve Bank Account HTML Template
Updated the Bank Account HTML template to enhance transaction record functionality. Bank account types were isolated to individual accordions for better consistency. Additionally, improvements were made in the bank transaction form, especially in transferring funds between accounts.

Updated wallet template and transaction handling
Added visual style enhancements to wallet.html for better transaction readability and simplified the bank transaction form. Implemented a more accurate account balance updating in views.py after each transaction, improving overall transaction handling.

Add Django logging file, enhance transaction display, and account balance updating
The wallet.html template now has added CSS styles, making the transaction table more readable by presenting varying background colors based on transaction types. Also, the form for creating bank transactions has been improved for simpler transfer handling between accounts. Additionally, the transaction handling in views.py now includes a more accurate post-transaction account balance updating mechanism.
This commit includes a new log file for the Django application under 'course_project_group_3'. It records file changes, HTTP requests, and server responses, providing an essential tool for understanding the runtime behavior, debugging, and problem diagnosis of the application.

Improved transaction table readability in wallet.html using CSS styles and revised date formatting. Addition of expense transaction type and updated handling of various transaction types has also been implemented. Further, made enhancements in the form used for bank transactions.

Update transaction handling in accounts views
Adjusted the way transactions adjust the account balance in accounts/views.py. Transactions will now accurately reflect the updated account balances post-transaction.
